reasons_to_visit.details: March remains low season in Turku (outside potential Easter). Enjoy lower prices and explore Turku Castle, Aboa Vetus & Ars Nova, and other museums without queues.
Daylight hours increase significantly throughout March, bringing a more optimistic feel. Snow often starts melting, especially later in the month, though it's often messy.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Focus on Indoor Culture & Cozy Cafes
reasons_to_visit.details: Ideal weather for exploring Turku's excellent indoor attractions: Turku Castle, Turku Cathedral, Aboa Vetus & Ars Nova, Turku Art Museum, Market Hall. Warm up in cozy riverside cafes.
A perfect time to embrace Finnish sauna culture. Seek out hotel saunas or local public options (if available) for a warming contrast to the cold.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Last Chance for Potential Frozen River/Sea Views
reasons_to_visit.details: Early March might still offer views of the frozen Aura River or nearby sea ice (walking on it requires extreme caution & safety checks).
Celebrate Waffle Day on March 25th by enjoying sweet or savory waffles available in many Turku cafes.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March is a transition month. Expect cold temperatures (avg highs 2-4°C/36-39°F), snow (early month), rain, sleet, and wind. Freeze-thaw cycles are peak.
Melting and refreezing make sidewalks and streets dangerously icy. High-quality waterproof boots with excellent grip and/or ice cleats ('liukuesteet') are absolutely crucial.
Sea ice breaking up restricts archipelago access. Parks (like Kupittaa) can be very slushy, icy, or muddy. Outdoor activities are limited.
Warm, waterproof layers are essential: thermals, fleece/wool, insulated waterproof coat, hat, gloves, scarf. Waterproof boots with superior ice grip are paramount.
Check dates! If Easter falls in late March, expect widespread closures (shops, Alko, some museums/restaurants) on Good Friday, Easter Sunday & Monday.
Melting snow creates wet, slushy, and muddy conditions ('kurakelit'). Waterproof footwear is essential for navigating the city.

weather.precipitation: Still feels like late winter. Snow likely, but rain/sleet possible. Ice is a major hazard. Daylight increases noticeably.
weather.general_tips: Full winter gear needed. Focus on waterproof boots with excellent grip; ice cleats highly recommended. Layering is key.

tourism_level.crowds: Low season. Museums and attractions are quiet.
tourism_level.pricing: Good value generally available for flights and accommodation.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Late winter feel. Potential for sunny cold days or more snow. Emphasis on indoor activities and enjoying the increasing light. Last chance for dramatic frozen river views (from safe distance).

events_holidays.name: Possible End of Outdoor Ice Rink Season (Parkin kenttä)
events_holidays.description: The artificial ice rink in Kupittaa Park usually closes sometime in March, weather permitting.
events_holidays.notes: Check City of Turku sports services for exact closing date.

unique_experiences.description: Visit Turku's main historical landmarks in quiet low season. Ideal indoor exploration for unpredictable weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours for Castle. Check opening times.

unique_experiences.description: Discover medieval Turku ruins underground combined with contemporary art. A fascinating and warm indoor activity.
Warm up with coffee, tea, or hot chocolate and Finnish pastries while enjoying views of the possibly icy Aura River.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Perfect way to spend a cold afternoon and watch the changing light.

unique_experiences.where: Hotel saunas, check for public options
unique_experiences.description: Embrace the Finnish tradition and warm up thoroughly in a sauna.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check hotel facilities or research local public sauna options and opening times.
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Variable (Free in hotels, Moderate for public)

weather.precipitation: Messy transition ('kurakelit'). Mix of snow, sleet, rain common. Freeze-thaw cycles peak, extreme ice hazard. Daylight increases significantly.
weather.general_tips: Waterproof boots with excellent grip are non-negotiable. Ice cleats remain essential. Waterproof outer layers critical. Prepare for wet and slushy streets.

tourism_level.crowds: Still generally low, but potential increase if Easter falls late March.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season value, but check for price spikes around Easter if applicable.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Signs of spring emerging amidst messy melt. Brighter, longer days are noticeable. Indoor focus remains key due to weather/conditions.

events_holidays.name: Waffle Day (Vohvelipäivä)
events_holidays.description: Enjoy sweet or savory waffles at cafes around Turku.
events_holidays.notes: Look for waffle specials in local cafes.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Pääsiäinen) (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: Major holiday period. Good Friday, Easter Sunday & Monday are public holidays.
events_holidays.notes: Verify exact dates. Expect widespread closures (shops, Alko, banks, some museums/restaurants). Plan meals and activities ahead. Public transport follows holiday schedule.

unique_experiences.description: Find a cozy spot and enjoy waffles on March 25th, a fun local tradition.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Many cafes will participate; check favorites like MBakery or Cafe Art.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through the historic indoor market hall, browsing local produce, meats, cheeses, and enjoying lunch or coffee at one of the stalls.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Great indoor refuge. Check opening hours (Mon-Sat, closes early afternoon).

unique_experiences.description: Explore Finnish and international art collections inside a beautiful granite building.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours, especially around Easter if applicable. Be careful on potentially icy paths up the hill.

unique_experiences.activity: Careful Walk Along the River Aura
unique_experiences.description: If paths are somewhat clear (can be very icy/slushy!), enjoy the increasing daylight with a walk along the river, observing signs of spring or melting ice.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Essential: Waterproof boots with best possible grip/ice cleats. Stick to main paths. Enjoy the brighter evenings.
unique_experiences.best_time: Daytime on a relatively dry/clear day
